title: Boots of Swiftness?
body: I've seen a ridiculously high amount of people buying Boots of Swiftness since the new patch. Considering neither boots nor movement speed were touched this patch, I can't figure out why they're being picked up. What did I miss?

replies.body: I prefer them over mobies these days.

Frost Queen's Claim is really popular. Blue Ezreal is really popular. Anivia is God Tier. Mundo is God Tier.

Long story short - every popular champion and his mother has a sh*t load of slows in their kit or FotM build. People are sick of said slows. Hence all of the Boots of Swiftness which specifically reduce the effectiveness of slows. Stormraider's Surge is also gaining popularity as a Keystone Mastery for that exact reason.
Also the cost. I was kind of expecting swiftys to cost more in the future patches.
It wasn't and won't because they're Utility Boots, not combat boots. They literally consist of Boots of Speed and a Combine cost.
Except they actually ARE getting more expensive in the PBE currently.
WIth rotations and champion movement speed being so valuable , swift boots seem to outshine their counterpart mobis in most cases. Then they can be sold for another set if you reach max items.

Yeah, but as soon as the meta shifts to Hard-Engage Mobility Boots will become the standard.

I wouldn't be surprised if FQC had its passive changed mid-way through this season.

Basically the reasons are several fold.

1. There are only 3 boots that cost only 800, Ionian (not always the best as you might not want the CDR), Mobility boots (you lose the bonus MS in combat and just getting to the fight isn't entirely important) and Swiftness boots.
2. There are actually so many slows in this game
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Slow#Slow
Here shows just the magnitude of how many champions have slows, and note that basically every champion outside of the can build slows
3. Both Deadman's Plate, and Rylai's are decently in meta
4. Everything is becoming a skill shot, more mobility = less chance of getting hit
5. They are like a better version of mobi's that don't turn off, which is why supports are changing to it, and junglers in particular.
6. Merc Treads got nerfed, these were actually the main boot's that were bought, and back in 5.22 they were changed to cost 100 less, but only give 20% tenacity over the 35% they used to offer.
The main reason is, games are ending quicker, you get less overall gold the shorter a game goes, Boots of Swiftness are cheap.
They're being built against teams with little-to-no slows and no slowing items are built.
i normaly always build swiftness on trundle apart from the occasional merc

Not sure why nobody has commented but one main reason is because of Frost Queens Claim. The boots are quite effective against the active and that item is very popular with atleast one or two each game.
